Question_Text: What is the earliest physical sign your social battery is draining (jaw, chest, gut, shoulders)?
Which environments make connection harder for you (noise, crowds, lighting, touch)—and what do you do to cope?
Who can you sit with in silence and feel no pressure? What makes that silence safe?
When someone reaches out, what makes you respond warmly vs. delay/ignore?
When someone is quiet, what do you assume first: ‘they’re angry’, ‘they don’t care’, or ‘I did something wrong’?
In conflict, what happens to your breath first (hold, shallow, fast)?
What tones/phrases instantly make you feel attacked or dismissed, even if the content is neutral?
After tension, how long is your ‘repair window’ (minutes/hours/days) before you start to harden/withdraw?
Under stress, do you pursue closeness, withdraw, or go numb? What is your earliest cue?
Do you trust until broken or mistrust until proven? What event taught you that default?
In your family of origin, what role kept you safest (achiever, peacemaker, invisible, caretaker)?
What did your environment teach you about conflict: dangerous, normal, or power?
What do you label as ‘neediness’ in yourself—when it might actually be a legitimate need?
Where do you try to control tone/timing/outcome in conversation to prevent discomfort?
What is your most common misread in relationships (rejection, disrespect, control, indifference)?
What is your shutdown tell in conversation (blank mind, numbness, irritability, leaving)?
What feeling do you block with logic in relationships (shame, fear, grief, longing)?
What ‘tax’ do you expect if you’re vulnerable (rejection, ridicule, obligation, loss of respect)?
What specific behaviors make you feel ‘seen’ (not intentions)?
What does ‘respect’ mean to you in behavior (tone, priority, competence, loyalty)?
Finish with specificity: ‘I feel safe with someone when they…’
What ‘micro-yes’ do you keep giving that creates resentment later?
What boundary do you set too late (or not at all)—and what do you pay for that delay?
After conflict, what is your 3-step repair protocol (say/do/stop)?
When you feel misunderstood, do you pursue (messages) or withdraw (silence)? What would a third option be?
What request do you avoid because it feels needy or risky? Write the cleanest version of it.
How do you prefer to receive feedback (timing, channel, tone)—and have you ever stated that preference explicitly?
What sentence reliably de-escalates conflict for you—and what sentence reliably escalates it?
Who are your top 3 safe people right now—and what exact behaviors make them safe?
When you’re dysregulated, what co-regulation action works fastest (walk, call, silence, touch)?
